nodes.bodyText: What are the reasons to have a new annotation and not reusing ValueMapping? Isn't ValueMapping also meant for enumerations?

I was thinking the same thing. The thing with @ValueMapping is that it is closer to @Mapping. It has a source and target. The new @EnumMapping is closer to @BeanMapping. The idea is to be able to configure general mapping only once for value mappings
Ahh, correct! @ValueMapping could be used multiple times
The suggestion makes sense. I'll do it
Null check required or could it never be null when build is called? The initializeEnumTransformationStrategy that will be called after this if-clause includes a null check

Good spot. I'll need to verify this again. In theory it can never be null, since we always create it (like the BeanMappingOptions). All tests are green as well, so the if condition is never hit it seems.
is this the inverse? What happens with inverse mappings?

Yes and no. I've implemented the reverse a tiny bit different. Have a look at
https://github.com/mapstruct/mapstruct/pull/2089/files#diff-281a6edb3173036b540a79288468f9ddR157-R186
Basically, I am applying the normal strategy on the target enum instead of the source enum. That way no special handling is needed
